body.p:
The State of Ohio, Montgomery County, SS,
The Court of Common Pleas of Montgomery County Ohio, of the Term of November in the year of our Lord One Thousand Eight Hundred and Sixty Four.

1st
The Jurors of the Grand Jury of the State of Ohio within and for the County of Montgomery in said State, empanneled, sworn and charged to inquire of Crimes and offenses committed within the said County of Montgomery in the name and by the authority of the State of Ohio, on their oaths do present and find: That George Maxwell intending and contriving one August^us^ Alfred VanHauten to deprive of his life, and him the said Augusutus Alfred VanHauten, unlawfully and of his deliberate and premeditated malice to kill and murder on the sixth day of October in the year of our Lord One Thousand Eight Hundred and Sixty Four, with force and arms, in the County of Montgomery aforesaid in and upon the said Augustus Alfred VanHauten then and there being, then and there, unlawfully, forcibly, purposely and of his deliberate and premeditated malice did make an assault, and that the said George Maxwell a certain pistol then and there loaded and charged with gunpowder and one leaden bullet, which pistol he the said George Maxwell in his right hand then and there had and held, then and there, unlawfully forcibly, purposely, and of his deliberate and premeditated malice, with the intent to kill, did discharge and shoot off, at, to, upon, and against the said Augustus Alfred VanHauten, and that the said George Maxwell, with the leaden bullet aforesaid, and of the pistol aforesaid then and there by force of the gunpowder aforesaid by the said George Maxwell discharged and shot off as, aforesaid, then and there unlawfully
forcebly purposely and of his deliberate and premeditated malance and with the intent to kill him the said Augustus Alfred VanHauten, did strike penetrate and wound the said Augustus Alfred VanHauten in and upon the right side of the breast of him the said Augustus Alfred VanHauten thereby then and there, going to him the said Augustus Alfred VanHauten in and upon the right side of the breast of him the said Augusuts Alfred VanHauten one mortal wound of the length of one Third of one inch of the breadth of one Third of one inch, and of the depth of six inches of which said mortal wound the said Augustus Alfred VanHauten then and there instantly died, and the Jurors aforesaid, on their oaths aforesaid do say, that the said George Maxwell, him the said Augustus Alfred VanHauten in the manner and by the means aforesaid, unlawfully, forcebily purposely, and of his delibereate and premeditated malice, did kill and murder, contrary to the form of the Statute in such case made and provided and against the peace and dignity of the State of Ohio.

2d
And the Jurors aforesaid at the term aforesaid on their oaths aforesaid, do further present and find, That George Maxwell intending and contrving, one Augustus Alfred VanHauten to deprive of his life, and him the said Augustus Alfred VanHauten, unlawfully, purposely and of his deliberate and premeditated malice to kill and murder on the sixth day of October in the year of Our Lord one Thousand Eight Hundred and Sixty Four with force and arms, in the County of Montgomery aforesaid, in and upon the body said Augustus Alfred VanHauten then and there being, then and there unlawfully, forcebly, purposely and of his deliberate
and premeditated malice, did make an assault and that the said George Maxwell a certain pistol then and there loaded and charged with gunpowder and a certain leaden bullet, and other destructive materials which said pistol he the said George Maxwell then and there in his right hand had and held, then and there unlawfully, forecebly, purposely and of his deliberate and premeditated malaice and with the intent to kill, did discharge and shoot off at, to, upon and against the said Augustus Alfred VanHauten and that the said George Maxwell with the leaden bullet and other destructive materials aforesaid, and, of the pistol aforesaid then and there by force of the gunpowder aforesaid by the said George Maxwell discharged and shot off as aforesaid, then and there unlawfully, forcebly, purposely and of his deliberate and premeditated malaice and with the intent to kill, him the said Augustus Alfred VanHauten; did strike penetrate and wound the said Augustus Alfred VanHauten in and upon the right ^side of the breast one inch above and external to the right^ nipple of him the said Augustus Alfred VanHauten, thereby then and there giving to him the said Augustus Alfed VanHauten in and upon the right side of the breast one inch above and external to the right nipple of him the said Augustus Alfred VanHauten one mortal wound of the length of one Third of one inch of the bredth of one Third of one inch and of the depth of six inches of which said mortal wound given as aforesaid he the said Augustus Alfred VanHauten on and from said sixth day of October in the year aforesaid from Seven and one half oclock in the afternoon of said day until Eight oclock in the afternoon of said day in the same year in the county aforesaid, did languish, and languishing did live on which
said day of October in the year aforesaid, at the hour aforesaid; he the said Augustus Alfred VanHauten in the County of Montgomery aforesaid, of the mortal wound aforesaid did died, and the Jurors aforesaid on their oaths aforesaid do say; that the said George Maxwell him the said Augustus Alfred Hauten in the manner and by the means aforesaid unlawfully, forcibly, purposely, and of his deliberate and premeditated malice did kill and murder, contrary to the form of the Statute in such case made and provided and against the peace and dignity of the State of Ohio,

4th3d
And the Jurors aforesaid, at the term aforesaid on their oaths aforesaid, do further present and find, That George Maxwell intending and contriving on August Alfred VanHauten to deprive of his life and him the said Augustus Alfred VanHauten unlawfully, purposefly, and of his deliberate and premeditated malice, to kill and murder, on the sixth day of October in the year of our Lord One Thousand Eight Hundred and Sixty Four, with force and arms, in the County aforesaid in and upon the said August Alfred VanHauten then and there being, then and there unlawfully, forcebly, purposely and of his deliberate and premeditated malice did make an assault, and that the said George Maxwell a certain pistol then and there loaded and charged with gunpowder and other destructive materials, which said pistol he the said George Maxwell then and there in this right hand had and held, then and there unlawfully, forcibly, purposely and of his deliberate and premeditated malice with the intent to kill did discharge and shoot off at, to, upon
and against the said Augustus Alfred VanHauten and that the said George Maxwell with the destructive materials aforesaid and of the pistol aforesaid then and there by force of the gunpowder aforesaid; by the said George Maxwell discharged and shot off as aforesaid then and there unlawfully forcebly, purposely and of his deliberate and premeditated malice and with the intent to kill him the said Augustus Alfred VanHauten did strike penetrate and wound the said Augustus Alfred VanHauten in and upon the right side of the breast one inch above and external to the right nipple of him the said Augustus Alfred ^Van^Hauten thereby then and there giving to him the said Augustus Alfred VanHauten in and upon the right side of the breast one inch above and external to the right nipple, of him the said Augustus Alfred VanHauten one mortal wound of the length of one Third of one inch of the breadth of one Third and one inch and of the depth of six inches of which said mortal wound the said Augustus Alfred VanHauten then and there instantly died; and the Jurors aforesaid on their oaths aforesaid do say, that the said George Maxwell him the said Augustus Alfred VanHauten, in the manner, and by the means aforesaid, unlawfully, forcibly, purposely and of his deliberate and premeditated malice did kill and murder, contrary to the form of the Statute in such case made and provided, and against the peace and dignity of the State of ohio,

4th
And the Jurors aforesaid, at the term aforesaid on their oaths aforesaid, do further present and find, That George Maxwell, on the Sixth day of October in the
year of our Lord One Thousand Eight Hundred and Sixty Four with force and arms in the County of Montgomery aforesaid in and upon the body of one Augustus Alfred ^Van^Hauten then and there being, unlawfully, forcebly, purposely and of his deliberate and premeditated malice did make an assault and that the said George Maxwell a certain pistol (commonly called a revolver) then and there loaded and charged with gunpowder and a certain leaden bullet and other destructive materials which said pistol he the said George Maxwell, then and there in his right hand had and held then and there purposely, willfully, and ^unlawfully^ of his deliberate and premeditated malice did discharge and shoot off to at, upon and against the said Augustus Alfred VanHauten and that the said George Maxwell with the leaden bullet and other destructive materials aforesaid and of the pistol aforesaid, then and there by force of the gunpowder aforesaid by the said George Maxwell discharged and shot off as aforesaid then and there unlawfully purposely and of his deliberate and premeditated maalice did strike penetrate and wound the said Augustus Alfred VanHauten in and upon the right side of the breast a little above and external to the right nipple of him the said Augustus Alfred VanHauten giving to him the said Augustus Alfred VanHauten then and there with the leaden bullet and other destructive materials aforesaid discharged and shot off out of the pistol aforesaid by the said George Maxwell in and upon the right side of the breast a little above and external to the right nipple of him
the said Augustus Alfred VanHauten purposely willfully, unlawfully and of his deliberate and premeditated malice one mortal wound of the length of one Third of one inch of the bredth of one Third of one inch, and of the depth of six inches of which said mortal wound he the Augustus Alfred VanHauten then and there instantly died and so the Jurors aforesaid on their oaths aforesaid do say that George Maxwell him the said Augustus Alfred VanHauten in the manner and by the means aforesaid unlawfully purposely, and willfully and of his deliberate and premeditated malice did kill and murder, contrary to the form of the Statute in such case made and provided, and against the peace and dignity of the State of Ohio,

Youngs V Wood
Prosecuting Attorney
Montgomery County Ohio
State of Ohio Montgomery County SS

I Frederick C. Fox Clerk of the Court of Common Pleas, in and for the County of Montgomery and State of Ohio, do hereby certify that the foregoing is truly taken and copied from the original Indictment now on file in my office in the City of Dayton said County.

Frank C. Fox Clerk
